summary: "The Silence of the Lambs" is a 1991 American horror-thriller movie based on Thomas Harris' novel. It stars Jodie Foster as FBI trainee Clarice Starling and Anthony Hopkins as the brilliant but cannibalistic Dr. Hannibal Lecter. Starling seeks Lecter's help to catch a serial killer, "Buffalo Bill," who skins his victims. The film was a huge success, winning all five major Academy Awards, making it the first horror film to win Best Picture. It's considered one of the greatest and most influential films of all time.
title: The Silence of the Lambs (film)
